intro: Cyrtandra hylematos, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra hylematos plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
